bug.author: DalilaB000
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>Checklist</denchmark-h>
I have verified that the issue exists against the master branch of AllenNLP. I have read the relevant section in the contribution guide on reporting bugs. I have checked the issues list for similar or identical bug reports. I have checked the pull requests list for existing proposed fixes. I have checked the CHANGELOG and the commit log to find out if the bug was already fixed in the master branch. I have included in the "Description" section below a traceback from any exceptions related to this bug. I have included in the "Related issues or possible duplicates" section beloew all related issues and possible duplicate issues (If there are none, check this box anyway). I have included in the "Environment" section below the name of the operating system and Python version that I was using when I discovered this bug. I have included in the "Environment" section below the output of pip freeze. I have included in the "Steps to reproduce" section below a minimally reproducible example.
<denchmark-h:h2>Description</denchmark-h>
Installed the latest allennp in its own environment, on my Mac OS 10.15.6 I have the latest Python 3.7 I'm trying to run the sample example: <denchmark-code> from allennlp.predictors.predictor import Predictor import allennlp_models.tagging predictor = Predictor.from_path("https://storage.googleapis.com/allennlp-public-models/ner-model-2020.02.10.tar.gz") predictor.predict( sentence="Did Uriah honestly think he could beat The Legend of Zelda in under three hours?" ) </denchmark-code>
but I either get an error that no module allennlp.predictos exists or no module allennlp_models exists Python traceback:
<denchmark-code></denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Related issues or possible duplicates</denchmark-h>
None
<denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
OS: Python version:
Output of pip freeze:
<denchmark-h:h2>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Example source:

comments.comment:
Cannot find allennlp_models python 3.7 Mac OS 10.15 <denchmark-code>from allennlp.predictors.predictor import Predictor import allennlp_models.tagging predictor = Predictor.from_path("https://storage.googleapis.com/allennlp-public-models/ner-model-2020.02.10.tar.gz") predictor.predict( sentence="Did Uriah honestly think he could beat The Legend of Zelda in under three hours?" ) </denchmark-code>
Error _--------------------------------------------------------------------------- ModuleNotFoundError Traceback (most recent call last) in 1 from allennlp.predictors.predictor import Predictor ----> 2 import allennlp_models.tagging 3 predictor = Predictor.from_path("<denchmark-link:https://storage.googleapis.com/allennlp-public-models/ner-model-2020.02.10.tar.gz>https://storage.googleapis.com/allennlp-public-models/ner-model-2020.02.10.tar.gz</denchmark-link> ") 4 predictor.predict( 5 sentence="Did Uriah honestly think he could beat The Legend of Zelda in under three hours?" ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'allennlp_models'_
Did you run pip install allennlp_models?

Yes I did install allennlp.
Regards,
Dalila On Tue, Sep 22, 2020 at 3:56 PM Matt Gardner ***@***.***> wrote:
Did you run pip install allennlp_models?

The error that you are seeing means that python can't find allennlp_models. This is a separate python package from allennlp. You need to run both pip install allennlp and pip install allennlp_models. Your error can only happen when pip install allennlp_models was not run, or something failed during installation.
This issue is being closed due to lack of activity. If you think it still needs to be addressed, please comment on this thread ðŸ‘‡
